definition: name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people

sentences.english: The salesperson said it was a famous world brand.
sentences.chinese: 那個售貨員說是世界名牌呢。

sentences.english: It is an inevitable choice to develop the strategy of famous brand for an enterprise in the keen market competitions.
sentences.chinese: 實施名牌戰略是企業在激烈的市場競爭中的必然選擇。

sentences.english: The world famous brand electrical control components to ensure long-term trouble-free operation of the machine.
sentences.chinese: 世界名牌電器控制元器件，確保機器長期無故障運行。

sentences.english: Products bearing famous trademarks sell well.
sentences.chinese: 標有名牌商標的產品暢銷。

sentences.english: All electrical appliances and accessories are provided by international famous brand products.
sentences.chinese: 所有電器及配件均採用國際名牌產品。

sentences.english: That series s selling point was not just sex and designer clothes.
sentences.chinese: 這一電視劇的賣點不僅只是性和名牌服裝。

sentences.english: Hebei Province in 1980 was named high-quality brand-name flavor of food.
sentences.chinese: 1980年又被評爲河北省優質風味食品名牌產品。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, the enthusiastic help of foreign brand-name entertainment companies settled in Putian.
sentences.chinese: 同時，熱情幫助外地名牌娛樂企業入駐莆田。

sentences.english: The famous-brand product of Leye organic thorny pear shall be found to promote production development well. 5.
sentences.chinese: 創立樂業“名牌”有機刺梨，促進生產良性發展。

sentences.english: And inorder to imptove national economy and to be the world famous brand.
sentences.chinese: 爲振興民族經濟，爭創世界名牌作出我們不懈的努力。

sentences.english: I can’t understand why everyone is so crazy about big-name brands.
sentences.chinese: 我弄不懂大家爲什麼這樣熱衷於名牌商品。

sentences.english: They only sell “world famous brands” there.
sentences.chinese: 他們那裏只賣世界名牌。

sentences.english: The bearings, synchronous belts and electrical components are famous brands in china.
sentences.chinese: 軸承，電器元件，同步帶採用中國名牌。

sentences.english: It is a large leather suit case with my name tag. It'; s dark blue.
sentences.chinese: 它是一個膳縵沔繫有我名牌的大型皮製黑藍色行李箱。

sentences.english: The so-called "well-born" is to be famous maker of memory chips.
sentences.chinese: 所謂“出身名門”就是必須是名牌大廠的內存顆粒。

sentences.english: Admi ion to a top university is my goal.
sentences.chinese: 入讀名牌大學是我的目標。

definition: famous watch (i.e. expensive brand of wristwatch)
bag or purse etc/small bump or pimple/hillock
richly bedecked/dripping with gold and silver (idiom)
children of entrepreneurs who became wealthy under Deng Xiaoping's economic reforms in the 1980s/see also 窮二代|穷二代[qiong2 er4 dai4]
"Ms Perfect" (i.e. fair-skinned, rich and beautiful) (Internet slang)
